thread.title: iOS 10 Now Installed on 76% of Active Devices
thread.title_full: iOS 10 Now Installed on 76% of Active Devices

author: Evan Selleck
title: iOS 10 Now Installed on 76% of Active Devices
text:
iOS 10 Now Installed on 76% of Active Devices Posted by Evan Selleck on Jan 05, 2017 | No Comments Pin Shares 65 
Apple likes to keep tabs on its install base, and, periodically, the company will update everyone else on how everything is going. 
With the most recent update to its usage statistics page, the Cupertino-based company has confirmed that iOS 10 is now installed on 75% of devices out there in the wild. For what it’s worth, iOS 10 officially debuted to the world on September 13, 2016, so it’s been just over three months since Apple’s latest mobile operating system was published. 
The pie chart also includes iOS 9 and earlier versions of the mobile platform. iOS 9, as it stands, is at 18% of active devices, while earlier iterations stand at 6%. Apple has said in the past that iOS 10 has seen the fastest adoption rate of any of its releases to date.
